result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:04 PM Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista III not in court.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd in court for Juan Miguel Bautista III.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lloyd does not believe DE will be present.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
to Revoke DPA
Motion hearing on November 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender appointment
Motion hearing on September 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
to Revoke DPA
Atty Eisberner acknowledges rec. information and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Court enters NG pleas to counts 2, 3 and 4.

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista III in court.  Attorney Brent Eisberner in court for Juan Miguel Bautista III.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  State notes they are in compliance w/victim rights and VIS was filed in 22CM148 noting a request for restitution in that case but the victim has not submitted any amounts so she's asking the issue of restitution be held open in that matter.  22CF164 does have a VIS also and the Court has reviewed that.  Court questions the parties re: the names/victims.  Court reviews the CSR and parties agree w/the joint recommendation.  Court notes there has not been an arraignment in 22CF164 yet.  Court goes off the record to give DE and counsel time to discuss.  After arraignment, Court questions DE on plea agreement/voting rights/felony firearms warnings/body armor warnings.  DE pleads NC to Ct 1 in 22CF164, 22CM40 and 22CM148.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts.  DPA accepted in 22CF164 and Court finds DE guilty on Ct 1 in each of the CM cases.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 are dismissed/read-in in 22CF164.  State makes statement re: restitution - requesting hold open before the Court would schedule a restitution hearing.  Court asks that the State advise the Court w/in 60 days as to 22CM148 if they need a restitution hearing.  State makes statement re: the joint rec. in the 2 CM cases.  Atty Eisberner makes statement on behalf of the DE and the joint rec.  DE has nothing to add.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

22CF164
Ct 1:  NC - DPA for 36 months - ***ONE day credit if revoked
Cts 2, 3 & 4:  Dismissed/read-in

22CM40
Ct 1:  NC
***TWO days credit if revoked

22CM148
Ct 1:  NC

Ct 1 in each case - 24 months probation - DE to report to P&P by 3:45 pm today
Costs/surcharges of $453.00 in 22CM148 and $807.50 in 22CM40 - to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA samples to be provided
Conditions of probation:
Anger management assessment and any follow thru per agent
Any other treatment/programming per agent

2:12 pm.  Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista III in court.  Attorney Brent Eisberner in court for Juan Miguel Bautista III.  Atty Eisberner states there was an agreement reached but due to an error in paperwork they are requesting a plea/sent be reset.  Bonds continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista III in court, in custody by video from LEC.  Attorney Allison A Markoski appeared by video from LEC for Juan Miguel Bautista III.  Advised of rights to an attorney. DE will be applying for PD representation. Atty. Markoski explains non appearance, DE was in car accident.  Atty. requests signature bond. State requests reinstates signature bond. Court reinstates $1000.00 Signature  bond set with same conditions.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Atty Eisberner has not been appointed on this case but has not had any contact with DE in his other case.  Court notes the last notice was returned as undeliverable.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.

02:43 PM Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista in court with attorney Kathryn E Hayes.  Defendant Juan Miguel Bautista in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan Miguel Bautista appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE hasn't applied for PD appt yet.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State makes bail argument.  Atty Hayes responds.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with A.P.G., K.A.G., G.W.M., J.L.G. or D.L. or their residences, schools or places of employment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
